page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY IIII
page.content: In Cummertrees Parish smuggling was very common.Houses were specially built for smuggling goods.Hill house has still got cellars that were used. The people that lived in Hill House boasted that they had brandy porridge for breakfast.People even gave a name to a track called Brandy Loaning which leads from Powfoot to the main road. In 1894 a company from Liverpool called Bell and Burnie decided to open up a factory here,and built 4 brick terraces for their workers.There were great plans to make Powfoot into a holiday resort which failed due to the fact that the vital sea wall was never built,because of objections from the fishermen.There are still fishermen at Powfoot today.
